messages.message: For search, I would like to test with my email.  The note on adding gmail says that everyone in my workspace will be able to see it.  If I move to my own workspace, the list of data sources I can add drops down to google drive only.  Is there a way to test against my email without giving it to everyone in the workspace or in my private workspace?

Are you moving to your personal workspace within the organization, or are you moving to a community context? You should be able to mount any datasources to your personal workspace within the org. Note that org/site admins would still be able to access data sources mounted into your personal workspaces via API
I used the org drop-down and moved from "Instabase" to "Jason Robey" then in My workspace -> Data tab -> Add new data source and only Google drive was available.  I am on https://aihub.instabase.com.
Yep, you switched to the community context of your account. Go back to the organization context, click "Workspaces" at the top, then click "My workspace"

@Jessica I wonder if this isn't confusing.  As a user, I am trying to limit this to me or my workspace.  It is not obvious to me how to go to my workspace and make sure I haven't shared it with anyone.  I would not want to flood their searches with my spam.

This feedback came up recently, that people were confused about switching contexts: https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C0516UPPMT3/p1736415322882909 cc @hannah and @alagu

No one else has access to your personal workspace (though org admins can access it if they need to), and you can't add more people to it. Anything you add to that workspace ~will~ won't show up for other org members.
